intro: Hieracium comaticeps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium comaticeps is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators.
